text:
Cisco's primary vision
is to bring the power

of generative AI to our
customer's point of need,

and doing that in an ethical,
secure, responsible way.

Cisco's responsible AI
policies help ensure fairness,

you know, lack of bias in
these AI systems,
transparency to our customers

in how their data's
being processed and used,
and that helps drive trust in the AI
products that we are building.

The key challenge for us was
building a cost effective
solution for a product feature
that didn't require high load,

but it required a lot of
regional availability,

wide regional availability,
and low latency.
Cisco chose to use Amazon Bedrock
because of the ease of access

to cutting edge models from
a variety of providers.
We have kind of a multi-layered approach
to using Bedrock in our development
and integration environment.
The value of Bedrock comes in being able

to have multi-regional
deployments globally
so we can keep our customers data
in their geographical region.
And then also the scale being able to
easily scale out features,

especially when we're
first deploying features.

Many times, if we were to
operate that model ourselves,

the cost would be prohibitive
to operate it just

for initial use cases until
until the usage is ramped up.

Our partnership with AWS has
really accelerated Cisco's

ability to deliver AI
features to our customers.
